page.title: 13Oldmeldrum Sports Celebrity
page.content: The gala sports day held in Oldmeldrum each year is usully opened by an entertainment celebrity. In the last few years these have included Diana Dors, an international star; Selina Scott, a Yorkshire girl who spent two years with Grampian Television in Aberdeen before joining BBC-TV Breakfast Time; and Jane Franchi, a local girl who gained popularity through her television work for BBC Scotland. Part of the celebrity's duties at the Sports is to award the prize to the winning youth group in the float parade. This event involves young people from all the local clubs and sports groups who decorate their trailer float to a given theme and perform their chosen drama while being towed around the field by a tractor. Prizes for the three winning entries are Â£5, Â£10 and Â£15.
